metadata.title: Evaluate to true if unix-def:interface_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evaluate to true if the interpreter properly supports unix-def:interface_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.
Information regarding the interfaces on your particular machine can be found by running the 'ifconfig' utility.

criterion.comment: Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression using the var_ref attribute.

interface_test.comment: Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value using the var_ref attribute.
Test that the interface_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression using the var_ref attribute.

interface_object.comment: This object represents an interface_object where the name equals 'lo0'.
interface_object.name: lo0

interface_object.comment: This object represents an interface_object where the name is not equal to 'en1'.
interface_object.name: en1

interface_object.comment: This object represents an interface_object where the name matches the regular expression '^(?!lo0)'.
interface_object.name: ^(?!lo0)

interface_object.comment: This object represents an interface_object where the name equals 'lo0' using the var_ref attribute.
This object represents an interface_object where the name is not equal to 'lo0' using the var_ref attribute.
This object represents an interface_object where the name matches the regular expression '^e.+1$' using the var_ref attribute.

interface_state.comment: This interface_state represents an interface_object where the inet_addr equals '127.0.0.1'.
This interface_state represents an interface_object where the name equals 'en1'.
interface_state.name: en1

interface_state.comment: This interface_state represents an interface_object where the flag equals 'UP'.

constant_variable.comment: This constant_variable represents the string value 'lo0'.
This constant_variable represents the string value '^e.+1$'.
